'Portsmouth' is a city in Rockingham County, New Hampshire, in the United
States. It is the largest (and only) city, but only the fourth-largest community
in the county, The Rockingham County towns (not cities) of Derry (33,109),
Salem (28,776), and Londonderry (24,129) had greater populations according to
the 2010 census. with a population of 21,233 at the 2010 census. United States Census Bureau,
[http://factfinder2.census.gov/main.html American FactFinder], 2010 Census
figures. Retrieved April 1, 2011. A historic seaport and popular summer tourist
destination, Portsmouth was the home of the Strategic Air Command's Pease Air
Force Base, later converted to Portsmouth International Airport at Pease, though
there has been no commercial passenger service since 2008.
categories: Populated places in Rockingham County, New Hampshire
